: ​ I believe my entry fee was the stress of meeting everyone's expectations. -- For most of my life I've been trying my best to break milestones that my father, teammates, and scouts would set for me. Day after day, I'd practice and would worry about failing to meet their expectations. --I wanted to make them happy and see their smile....and I would never want to see my father frown.. Once the weight was lifted off of my shoulders, I felt relieved and I could finally open up to others... As crazy as this place is, I'm happy that I've had this opportunity... --And after seeing what it was like to truly have friends... I've also felt what it was like to lose them.
: ​ But I still want to keep moving forward....for myself and for others.
: ​ Watching everyone grow, I can now relate to my father and his feelings..
: You're able to focus on yourself more, mm?
: I've been giving myself a lot of treats at Sol's shop~.
: The only expectations that you should even worry about in the grand scheme of things are your own, for yourself. Not others'.
: I hope this has helped you feel more driven, Kazunori.
: ​ My message to the others is that you should reward yourself for making milestones you care about and not just everyone elses.. and I'm thankful, Jean.

: ​...Before the Game. Before all this... There's someone I lost. Well, someone who left me, really... A former dear friend of mine. And ever since that... I never wanted to feel that sense of loss again, and I was sure that all people really care about is superficial stuff. That one way or another someone will always find a way to betray you. So, I used that where I could, twisted people around my little finger while keeping them all at arm's length, and my thoughts to myself. Even the few friends I couldn't help but make, I always kept a little of myself from.​

: ​ I-I was struggling with….. Perception… Basically, for every person I met, I met them with a smile and then …. Left their life forever. Every time I tried to talk to someone, I felt so…. Inept… Insignificant…….. ​ alone..​ It’s not that they hated me… It’s that…. ​I didn’t want to give them the chance to…… I didn’t want them to see the same terrible things I saw in myself…​ I figured…. That people were just better off with a life without me… I could only bring problems and nervousness and…… burdens……. I thought to myself: No one deserves to bear these but me… I deserve it because I’m the one who acts this way in the first place… I’m the one who suspects people….. They really didn’t show that they were untrustworthy……. And yet….. I was the one who was angry with them…. I was the one becoming suspicious….

: What changed was that…. I was forced to see every side of people…. I became unable to avoid people I was scared of disappointing…. It didn’t stop me from assuming I disappointed them… but…. I couldn’t run away anymore…. The only way to live with the fear was to learn about them… My friends, I mean… I learned to be okay with asking them for reassurance… and since I had given myself a chance with them…. I learned that… Maybe people aren’t nearly as scary as they seem from afar…..

: ​ It was holding me back because……. I couldn’t meet anyone….. I had closed off my entire world…. I only left my home occasionally, and…… forced myself to be afraid……… It didn’t feel like I was prematurely judging people, but…. In a way, I was…. Even when I first came here, I was almost too scared to make a pact with someone……

: b-but now, I’m friends with every player here…. And I trust them more than anything….. Even when I get worried, I can still ask them for reassurance and…. It doesn’t make me a bad friend…. I just… need a little extra help…. And I’ve found people I can rely on, and…. I want them to rely on me….

: ​ I think....my entry fee, was my ability to give harsh judgement on myself. I'm a writer, and a perfectionist, and I would always rely on my own sense of doubt and criticism to make sure I didn't mess up anything important. But...my thoughts went far past that, and they would hold me back from more than just a wrong choice of words in a story or an essay. I would neglect to tell people who cared about me what was wrong if I was in pain or needed help. Because I told myself that I didn't deserve to bother them with their help, but then I would tell myself that I was stupid for not doing anything and not reaching out. I would restrict myself from acting like my normal self in public because I'd thoughts that would judge me foolish or sentimental or pathetic or a dirty piece of trash. But...even though it hurt, I relied on it being there. I relied on those thoughts to assure me of myself and my own image. -- Once the Fee was taken, it took me a while to figure out what I lost, but I knew I felt different. Like a weight was taken off of my mind and soul. The absence of it made itself known by pain in my mind instead of words, but without the words, I could ignore the pain and let myself out of my cage. I could let out my imagination.... I could "Take Chances, Make Mistakes, Get Messy," and most importantly....I learned that I can rely on others just as I let them rely on me. I want to be able to keep doing that. I want to Keep Moving Forward.
